comment: The content for MGT 4199 was not my favorite, but Professor Hill made it more interesting. His lectures connected the content to real-world examples. There is an individual paper and a group paper, so be ready to write, and pick your group members wisely. He does take attendance every class, and his class is more interactive.

Probably one of my favorite professors I've ever had. Truly a great and engaging guy with a genuine desire to teach. He gives great feedback and is always there to listen. I recommend him taking him especially if you have an interest in management.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: He rambles a lot and talks wayyyyyyy too much but is super chill and really cares about us succeeding. Work load is manageable for sure. I would reccommend him.

I took Professor Hill for a virtual study abroad class, and he was great! He was very responsive and gave great feedback on assignments. Class participation was key for this course. Professor Hill has become one of my favorites! I highly recommend him.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: If you talk to him then youll be fine. Dont take if public speaking scares you.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Take him, take him now. He's great and funny, just go to class and actually care. I failed my first two test and just tried on the last two got A's and a B in the class. Read the book, it's not a bad book!
Ken is great. He is one professor that I am certain cares for my well being. He loves group discussions during lectures and really gives an interesting angle on topics.

Loved taking Professor HIll's class. One of the best professors I have ever taken in my educational career. He really expanded my knowledge on the topics of present day and the past, making me a much better global citizen. He wants you to succeed, but don't take advantage of his generosity, do the work, study hard, and enjoy it.
This man was my favorite professor at KSU. Our class was very fun and I would recommend to any serious college freshman. You will have basic work but he does his best to prepare you for life.

Hill's class is very active and will make you work for your A. His tests are killer, but our pop quizzes turned out to be extra credit. Pay attention and read the book and you should be fine. Not much busy work, but projects galore. Do what's asked adn you'll live. Ken does a lot for his students and is willing to help you out whenever possible.

Ken Hill, is a very personable professor! However, the content is very specific and rather confusing! The tests are all online other than the final, and the tests were very difficult! Be sure to get the book that he wants, I didn't purchase it and still managed a B but it was borderline.
Ken must be on here self rating.  He is NOT easy.  His lectures are a mess and are nearly impossible to follow.  Nice guy but not worth taking if you want an A.

If all professors were like Mr. Ken, the world would be a better place. He challenges you and makes you work hard and he is so excited about what he teaches. He is willing to answer any question and truly cares about your success...one of the nicest, most relatable people at KSU. Not easy though :)

I don't recommend taking his class. The content is taught horribly and there was nothing I really took from this class. He does not give much leeway when you come to him with a legitimate issue. if you need clarification on something he is not that good at helping you. Be prepared to be put on the spot. If you want an easy A, take another prof.
I suggest not to take this class, the lectures are confusing and so are the directions to many assignments. He's a great guy, but not when it comes to teaching.

I LOVE Ken! He's such a wonderful guy and looks just like Stanley Tucci! However, this is a VERY hard class. You have to read an article or two before every class and really pay attention in class. Stay up to date on current events! Too hard for a freshman seminar. I wish he taught something else!

I don't know how the rest of the reviews are so great, but no one I know enjoyed this class. The lectures were a muddled mess of ideas that did not really interconnect, and the subject matter was  rather unclear. Not an easy A like all other freshman seminars. Hill is a nice guy, but not a good choice of a seminar professor. Don't take this class.

He is an okay guy. NOT helpful when you ask questions. He beats around the bush and will not give you a direct answer. Class is a ton of work and tests are hard. Very opinionated. Do not take if you want an easy A.

Mr. Ken is a great teacher! He is very kind and asks how you are doing all the time. He knows what he is talking about. When he talks about something important, he whispers. He is really passionate about global issues. Class is a little scattered and due dates change. Relatively easy class. Definitely enjoyable.

If you can help it, do NOT take this class. While everyone else has a fun and easy freshman seminar class, this class was so hard. It is way too much work for a simple seminar class. He is unorganized and scatter brained. The syllabus was changed 3+ times. Nice guy and very passionate, but not worth it! Take an easy professor for this class.

Ken Hill is the best. He takes a personal interest in you and wants you to succeed. This class was so much because he talked with us and wanted our opinion and didn't talk at us. You need to go to class and take notes, and ask questions, but it's not hard if you just do it. He is an amazing happy guy who cares about his students take his class.

If you need some pep in your day then you should take Ken. He is probably the most excited person I have ever met. He's happy about everything. He is so flexible. He'll move a due date back an entire month if needed. He is so helpful with practically everything. Have fun with your Global Village project!

The honors version of this is so tedious. I understand that it's honors, but there was so much work. While your friends are learning about listening skills and how to study, you'll be doing global projects, learning about other countries & current events. Not a bad class, but his disorganization doesn't help. If you take him be prepared to work.

Professor Hill is a great guy. He is very funny always open to differing opinions and very understanding. On another note he is so disorganized. Our syllabus had to change at least 3+ times. Half of the time no one in class knew what to read or what was due. His group project which is a big chunk of your grade was horrific. Lots of work also!!
He's an alright teacher. He's very nice but much of the class is based off of his opinion but he is open to discussion and contradiction. Overall not a bad teacher.

Ken cares about his students and wants to see all of them accomplish something. His class seems to vary by semester, and he changes the syllabus around a lot. You'll need to ask him what you're supposed to be reading. Tests are extremely difficult especially if he doesn't give quizzes that semester. Tests come from the articles, powerpoints, etc.

awesome guy, always ready to help. tests are hard, but there's a lot of other assignments to balance it out. mainly an economics course, but definitely interesting. i recommend taking him, if you're struggling with something he won't turn you away & tries to work with you on your grade
He is very nice. The class has great discussions but the readings are very painful sometimes. The quizzes can be difficult as well. Great in class but tests are hard.
Very very nice person, but a very hard class with a lot of work.

LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE himm!! class is hard, but he's worth it! very helpful and funny. lots of debates and he will do anything to make you happy! great guy! take him take him take him!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

He makes KSUseless a bit more fun.Awesome guy who really cares about his students. Take this class, show up, and converse w/ him. As long as you are not a jerk and do the work its an easy A. Follow his guidelines accurately. The hardest part were the tests... but I probably failed half and still made an A.

Great teacher, with a lot of energy.  There is a lot of reading in this class as well as discussing what you read. Considering it is a generic forced class to new students, I can say overall it's a good class. Weekly quizzes,2 presentations, discussions are graded too, so don't ignore them. Attendance is the key to success in this class.

Professor Hill is the best professor anyone could ever have! He's super nice and loves what he teaches and his students and he still remembers my name every time he sees me. The class isn't hard and I genuinely loved being there and I learned a lot more than I ever expected. TAKE HIS CLASS!

Great professor who really cares about his students and the topics he teaches, but he does give a lot of assignments, so be prepared to work hard. However, if you are willing to work hard I highly recommend this professor.

Great professor, however there is a lot of work in this class.  I feel like there are too many assignments during the semester.  This class is a spin off of KSU 1101, has Global Issues and how things relate to the 7 Revolutions which makes up most of the class.
Really nice guy. Loves what he teaches and is willing to help anyone out.  Deffintely take him

He is a great professor. Whenever I was late on turning in assignments, he would work with me and extend the due date. He really does want everyone to do there best in his class, he'll basically bend over backwards to assure that happens!!

Hill is a very nice guy and I bonded with him. I did not know the class would be tons of hours of work though. Its important to go to class because he teaches important stuff for tests and gives alot of homework. He proves to make the class challenging, DO YOUR WORK!! Reading, quizzes, homework, huge Career research project, communityservice, yeah.

Fun guy and a great teacher. The class kind of lame (no fault of his) and was more work-intensive than I imagined it would be, but he's very fair and more than willing to help. He's an extremely respectful, kind, genuine and funny person and I enjoyed every class.

Take this class with him. It's the stupidest class in the world, but you will actually get stuff out of it thanks to the projects and work he gives you. I've been out of his class for a year and still talk to him when I see him - he's a sweet guy and I'd take all of my classes with him if I could!

I love Ken. That'a all there is to it. The KSU class is dumb but you might as well take it with him because he makes it fun. I really do enjoy going to this class because we have all become really good friends and it's such a great atmosphere. There is some work to do but he makes it fun and easy!
He was a great teacher. you have to work though haha, not extremely easy, go to class, too. Made an A

By far my favorite professor this semester. I don't think I would have made it through without him. Wonderful teacher and person. He makes students want to talk to him even after you are finished with his class :) I know students next semester won't get to do this but he's even inspired me to go out in the world and save slaves(human trafficking)!

My favorite professor! Overall, the class is silly and pointless, but worth it for Hill bonding time. If you cannot avoid KSU 1101 DEFINITELY take Hill.  Go in with a positive attitude and you will have so much fun!  Great semester.
Mr Hill is amazing!! one of my favorite techers ever! he is very personable. His class is not hard at all if you read the material.No final!
The class is extremely stupid but he is a great teacher. Very nice and passionate about the class and KSU. His grading is a little bit harder than usual but just follow the guidelines.
he is a polite guy who shows respect for his students. the class is dumb, but he is a good teacher and a good person.
He's a very nice fellow.  He cares about your academic performance as well as your personal life.  He is very talkative, and encourages you to participate in campus life.  Take him!

great guy. He has a lot of fun with what he does and is interested in your personal life. He as always there when I needed him. We also had a really small class so everything was a little more personal. Final was a definite breeze. And yea, I took him at 8 am.

By far my favorite teacher at KSU! He is passionate about what he is teaching and truly desires to make a difference in the lives of students. I wish all of my professors were like him! His class does require a LOT of work, but as long as you do it, it's pretty straight-forward and simple. Very helpful professor, made my first semester wonderful!

Mr. Hill was a great teacher. The class, if used appropriately will help you gain more knowledge about yourself and your abilities.  He understands if you cannot make deadlines. BUT you must let him know your circumstances in advance. Don’t take advantage of his kindness!!
Easy A! Wonderful teacher and very understanding. There was homework, but he is very flexible with deadlines.

Great professor!! One of the best at KSU.  Understanding and overall a fun professor.  Yes, there are a lot of projects to keep up with but he will be flexible with due dates.  Easy A if you actually do the work and keep up with project due dates.  Highly recommended!
Very nice professor, Take it if you want to have fun in a terrible class subject. He is helpful and understanding, but don’t take advantage of his patience!  Highly recommended!

The class was so boring and the projects and homework were time consuming. The class is so easy if you actually pay attention and do the work. He is very understanding on due dates and absences as long as you email before hand. Very nice teacher

A great guy teaching a horrific course. If you have the unfortunate need to take the class, this would be the professor to take. Deadlines are fluid, and he understands and appreciates honesty with trouble making them. Try not to take advantage too much.
Good guy willing to help anyone   barely ever holds due dates and accomidates any personal problems
